definitions: hypocritical and sanctimonious talk, typically of a moral, religious, or political nature.
language peculiar to a specified group or profession and regarded with disparagement.
to talk hypocritically and sanctimoniously about something.
examples: He dismissed their arguments as pious cant.
The cant of the legal profession.
He would cant about the virtues of honesty.
They canted about their supposed good deeds.
